summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from August 20, 2019, discussing the status and handling of hard drives related to the Epstein investigation. The drives were initially missed during a search warrant, later recovered from a third-party residence, and are undergoing forensic processing with concerns about encryption and privileged information. The email indicates high-level interest from the Deputy Director (DD) and others due to the potential to identify co-conspirators.

persons.name: Sony
persons.context: Addressed in the opening line of the email; appears to be an FBI colleague being updated on the status of the hard drives.

events.title: Media received by FBI
events.description: Evidence sheets indicate media (likely the hard drives) was received by the FBI on this date.

events.title: Evidence recovered from third-party residence
events.description: Evidence (hard drives) was received from a third party's residence in mid to late July. The residence owner turned it over quickly, stating an associate had placed it there.

keyFacts: Hard drives of interest were in Jeffrey Epstein's safe during an initial FBI search warrant but were not seized due to lack of authority at that time.
When agents returned a week later, the drives were missing from the safe. They were later recovered after the individual who took them was contacted and surrendered them.
The drives were recovered from a third-party residence; the owner stated an associate had placed them there and he wanted nothing to do with them.

There is internal FBI confusion and high-level interest (from the Deputy Director, ADIC, CID, and the Attorney General) regarding whether the drives are encrypted and their forensic prioritization, as they may lead to co-conspirators.
The drives are undergoing a 'taint process' due to the potential for containing privileged information.
